modules.description: This module provides functions that return required values by composing existing Soup operations with a requirement check, eliminating optional wrapping. It works directly with HTML nodes and sequences, offering precise access to elements via CSS selection, traversal, and property extraction. Use this when you expect a specific HTML structure and need to enforce the presence of elements, attributes, or text, such as extracting the first paragraph of an article or verifying a page title.

This module provides functions that operate on HTML nodes and elements, enabling precise navigation and extraction of data from parsed HTML documents. It includes operations for selecting elements by tag, attribute, or position; retrieving text content; and traversing the DOM tree upward or between siblings. Concrete use cases include scraping specific elements from a webpage, extracting attribute values, and navigating structured HTML content programmatically.

This module provides infix operators for querying and traversing HTML or XML documents using CSS selectors. It works with `Lambdasoup.node` values, allowing selection of elements via `$` (first match), `$?` (optional first match), and `$$` (all matches). Concrete use cases include extracting specific nodes from parsed documents, navigating DOM structures, and filtering elements based on selector patterns.

This module defines infix operators for concise DOM traversal and element selection using CSS selectors. It works with HTML nodes and sequences of nodes, enabling direct navigation and filtering. Use these operators to write compact expressions for selecting elements, accessing their attributes, or chaining traversals.

This module supports operations to select, filter, and transform HTML/XML content using CSS selector syntax and DOM-like traversal, enabling precise element targeting and structural manipulation. It works with hierarchical node structures represented as `node`, `nodes`, and `soup` types, offering utilities to inspect attributes, extract text, modify document trees, and serialize results. Specific use cases include web scraping, data extraction pipelines, and programmatic HTML editing where structured navigation and mutation are required.

This module enables HTML parsing, traversal, and transformation using CSS selectors and functional combinators. It operates on hierarchical node structures and lazy sequences of nodes, supporting operations like attribute/class manipulation, subtree filtering, and structural mutations (e.g., inserting, replacing, or removing elements). Typical applications include web scraping pipelines, HTML document reformatting, and programmatic content extraction or transformation workflows.
